intro.title: Welcome to The Game of Poker
intro.description: A game of deception and manipulation with a little bit of luck in there as well

rules.rule: Poker is a five-card game where the goal is to have the highest combination. Or you can bluff opponents into folding.
Players go around and place bets each round. At the end of each round, players can 'call', 'raise', or 'fold'.
After the final betting round, players reveal their hands, and the player with the best hand wins the pot.
Hand rankings include pairs, straights, flushes, full houses, and the best possible hand, the 'royal flush'.

guide.description: Familiarize yourself with hand combinations and rankings.
Bait opponents when you have a strong hand. Play aggressively when bluffing.
Fold when you are unsure about your hand to minimize losses.
The player with the highest-ranking hand takes the pot.

tips.tip: Play fewer hands but play aggressively.
tips.description: Be patient and wait for strong hands. When you get one, play aggressively to assert dominance.
Bluff strategically and avoid being predictable. Watch how your opponents react.
Observe opponents' behaviors. Learn their tendencies to read them better.
